result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey N Broady Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 11 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered to be paid as follows:  $500 payable to the victim and $8,657.86 payable to American Family Insurance.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.
03-07-2018 RESTITUTION CORRECTED TO BE PAID JOINT AND SEVERAL WITH CO-ACTORS. $8,657.86 IS OWED TO STATE FARM INSURANCE AND NOT AMERICAN FAMILY. 

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim or their residence.
No contact with the co-actors (including father).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2
Received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Dominic Busalacchi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Corey N Broady in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 4 is dismissed as a read in.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
100 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
11 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim or their residence or Co-Actors (including his father) listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

Restitution:  $9,157.86 joint/several with co-actors (Breakdown: $500 to the Victim (K.C.) and $8,657.86 to American Family Insurance) - to be paid first.
Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
